title: How to Get Cloth in Stardew Valley: Craft and Tailor Guide

steps.title: Raise adult Sheep and/or Rabbits.
steps.content: Raise adult Sheep and/or Rabbits. A baby sheep matures after four (4) consecutive days of being fed. A baby rabbit matures after six (6) consecutive days of being fed. Be sure to interact with your animals daily to keep their happiness up. While processing Wool in a Loom is the most reliable way to get Cloth, you can also: Trade three (3) Aquamarine for one (1) Cloth with the Desert Trader on Wednesdays Place a Soggy Newspaper in the Recycling Machine (10% chance) Defeat Mummies in the Skull Cavern (20% / 5% drop rate) [1] X Research source

steps.title: Collect Wool.
steps.content: Collect Wool. To make Cloth, you must have Wool. Adult Sheep can be sheared for Wool every three (3) days, and adult Rabbits drop Wool automatically every four (4) days. [2] X Research source Shears can be purchased from Marnie's Ranch for 1000g. If you have the Shepherd profession , Sheep will produce wool much faster.

steps.title: Craft a Loom.
steps.content: Craft a Loom. You must have Farming Level 7 to get the recipe, and 60 Wood, 30 Fiber, and 1 Pine Tar to craft it. Similar to Maple Syrup Oak Resin , Pine Tar can be obtained by tapping a Pine Tree.

steps.title: Place the Wool in the Loom.
steps.content: Place the Wool in the Loom. The Cloth will take four (4) in-game hours to process. When it's finished, you'll see the Cloth icon above the Loom. If you have Silver, Gold, or Iridium Wool, you have a 10/25/50% chance to collect two Cloth. Consider crafting multiple Looms if you have a lot of Wool to process.

steps.title: Tailoring.
steps.content: Tailoring. If you have obtained at least 1 Cloth, Emily will appear the next day and invite you to use her sewing machine. Each clothing item requires 1 Cloth and can be combined with other items to create certain clothing. To make clothes, do the following: Go to Emily and Haley's house. Interact with the sewing machine. Place 1 Cloth in the first slot. Place any other item in the second slot. For a complete recipe list, you can visit this website . Place the clothing into your inventory.

steps.title: The Community Center.
steps.content: The Community Center. Cloth can be used for the Artisan Bundle in the Pantry.

steps.title: Crafting.
steps.content: Crafting. You can craft a Dressed Spinner with 2 Iron Bars and 1 Cloth. This requires Fishing Level 8.

steps.title: Building.
steps.content: Building. You can create a Mill with 50 Stone, 150 Wood, and 4 Cloth.

steps.title: Open your inventory.
steps.content: Open your inventory. You should see the clothes you want to equip in your normal inventory. At the bottom, you'll see your character along with the equipment slots.

steps.title: Drag the item into the equipment slot.
steps.content: Drag the item into the equipment slot. Make sure you use the correct slot. For example, drag a new shirt into the shirt equipment slot. The new clothing will be equipped.
